author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
The problem is while validating the path, it splits `\\server\share\folder` by the backslash so the root is just `\` and the path ends up being `\server\share\folder` which isn't valid.  Fix is on Windows to add extra slash if the root is `\`

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4990

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I don't like the change being outside of the filesystemprovider, let me see if I can rework this.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT yeah, it would be the best if we can fix the `GetParentPath` to take into account UNC paths.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @daxian-dbw `GetParentPath` gets called repeatedly to validate the entire path from leaf to root.  I think putting the fix in NormalizePath() may be better.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov I've noticed that the providers get called a lot.  Perhaps GetParentPath() is the right place even thought that gets called a lot as well, but we only need to make it a UNC path again if it's at the root.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I wonder why we have to call NormalizePath method so many times on the same path? Maybe we can fix this?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov I created https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/5002 as the perf work item

title: enable using filesystem from a UNC location
